definitions.title: n.f.
definitions.body: province (an Aramaic word, cf. Syr. mdiyto0, Ar. madiynah;un city)—Es 1:1 + 28 t.; pl. [[מְדִינוֹת]] 1Ki 20:14 + 23 t.;—a district of an empire,
districts of realm of Ahab with [[שׂרים]] over them 1Ki 20:14, 1Ki 20:15, 1Ki 20:17, 1Ki 20:19.
of the Babylonian empire: Ez Eze 19:8; Da 8:2 (of Elam); [[שָׂרָתִי בַּמְּדִינוֹת]] princess among the provinces La 1:1 (of Judea).
of the Persian empire Es 1:1 + oft.; one of which was Palestine, Ne 1:3; the returning exiles, [[בְּנֵי הַמְּדִינׇה]] children of the province Ezr 2:1, Ne 7:6 having [[רָאשֵׁי הַמְּדִינׇה]] Ne 11:3.
provinces in general Ec 2:8, Ec 5:7; [[בְּמִשְׁמַנֵּי מְדִינׇה]] in the fat places of the province Da 11:24 (fertile regions, prob. Egypt; other trans. vid. in Bev.)
